ngiemboon: Aláʼ la gyá páʼ Mǒonsê la te ne ńdwo fó ndùm lekwɛ́, ésẅɛ́ʼɛ wɔ́; á gwɔ́ púʼu pɔ́ pú ńcúʼte ńkéle Áloŋ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Nyɛte tsɔ́ messé mie é ge giŋe mvfò peg! Mélàʼmie Mǒonsê, á mbàŋa wa gẅie à la gÿo peg fó Egíbtò ńkẅɛ la, peg te ne ńzsé mmó gie á kéen ńgÿo yé wɔ́!
en: When the people saw that Moses delayed in coming down from the mountain, they gathered around Aaron and said to him, “Come, make gods   for us who will go before us because this Moses, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt #— #we don’t know what has happened to him! ”  # 32:1 Ex 13:21; 24:18; Dt 9:9; Ac 7:40

ngiemboon: Áloŋ gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi sẅɛ meyaléŋ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, é mie ée na metuŋó mezwě pí, mbɔɔ penkʉ́ pí pembàŋa lâ pepanzwě ńdɔg ńtó, ńnáa mbwó mèŋ.
en: Aaron replied to them, “Take off the gold rings   that are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters and bring them to me.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a láʼ metsèm la sẅɛ meyaléŋ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, é mie é laa metuŋó pɔ́b, ńdɔg ńtó ńnáa mbwó Áloŋ.
en: So all the people took off the gold rings that were on their ears and brought them to Aaron.

ngiemboon: Á fó mbwó pɔ́b, ńkẅé tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, ńdɔ́ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ lekʉŋ tʉ̌, ńdɔg ḿbwóon tútú gẅie aa páʼ múɔ fòŋ. Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: E ssé yeg gie e ka fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅile wég eyɔɔn!
en: He took the gold from them, fashioned it with an engraving tool, and made it into an image of a calf.

ngiemboon: Áloŋ la gwɔ́ tà ńgyá púʼu, ńdeen ńkwɛ́ɛ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ mvfò wɛ̌ tútú, ḿbiŋ ńgaʼte ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé ge gÿo gwɔ́ jǔɔ, é jÿó tsɔ́ línɔ̀ɔn na lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a!
en: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar in front of it and made an announcement: “There will be a festival   to the Lord tomorrow.”

ngiemboon: Njÿó la lʉ́a, pɔ́ lu ssé tsɛ̀ɛ mbaʼámbaʼ, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ḿbiŋ ńná shúm pwɔʼ mbʉ́lè. Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ sẅɛ́ʼ, ńnéŋe ssé, lépfɛ́ɛ mmó, ḿbiŋ ńnú; afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ pɔ́ lu ssé, ńgÿo megʉa.
en: Early the next morning they arose, offered burnt offerings, and presented fellowship offerings. The people sat down to eat and drink, and got up to party.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a leen ńgɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: lo, sẅɛ́ʼɛ; mélàʼmie epʉ̀a pú, é pie ɔ̀ ka gÿo pɔ́ fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ la, pɔ́ kéen ḿbú fʉa tɛʼ.
en: The Lord spoke to Moses: “Go down at once! For your people you brought up from the land of Egypt have acted corruptly.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwǒon fó na mánzsè gẅie n da tÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b mǒ ésẅɛʼte nnɛ́; pɔ́ lɔgɔ́ tʉ̌ gie mé lɔ̌ɔn ńdɔg ńnyɛte tútú wɔb, tà sẅɛ́ʼ ńkẅíʼte mvfò yé, pɔ́ nuŋé shúm pwɔʼ mvfò yé, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: messé mú, é mɔɔn mbà Ésàlayɛ, é mie é la gÿo ɔ̀ fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ!
en: They have quickly turned from the way I commanded them; they have made for themselves an image of a calf. They have bowed down to it, sacrificed to it, and said, ‘Israel, these are your gods, who brought you up from the land of Egypt.’ ”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: N ne ńgyá ngie pʉ̀a pɔɔn ŋwɛ́, ée ngàŋa tʉʉtwó.
en: The Lord also said to Moses, “I have seen this people, and they are indeed a stiff-necked   people.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, nyé wɔ́ɔn, n gÿo mmó gie n gee ngÿǒ. N ge gyáŋa lóŋ na pɔ́b, n ge pyága wɔ́b tà shʉŋte, é piŋ gÿo ngẅɛ̀ jù kẅiʼi ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńcʉ́ʼʉ máamáa láʼ.
en: Now leave me alone, so that my anger can burn against them and I can destroy them. Then I will make you into a great nation.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê leen faʼa lésẅéte letʉ́m Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé ye; ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ɔ̀ faʼa légyáŋa lóŋ na pʉ̀a pú mélàʼakɔ́? Tá mbà gù zɔ la lɔg ngʉ̀ʼ, mbɔɔ metʉ̀ mú, ńgÿo pɔ́ fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ?
en: But Moses sought the favor of the Lord his God: “Lord, why does your anger burn against your people you brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and a strong hand?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, mbà pʉ̀a Egíbtò ge zye légɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ kẅɛɛ pɔ́ mélàʼmie à lɔ̌ɔn faʼa lézẅé wɔ́b ndùm mekwɛ́, mbɔɔ lépyága wɔ́b tà shʉŋte, ńgÿo pɔ́ pú ńdége ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.» Sẅéte letʉ́m shú sie é pú ne ńgyáŋa tɛʼ lɛ̂, nyé yɛ̌ nò tepòŋ gie ɔ̀ kɔʼɔ́ ne faʼa légÿo na pʉ̀a pú!
en: Why should the Egyptians say, ‘He brought them out with an evil intent to kill them in the mountains and eliminate them from the face of the earth’? Turn from your fierce anger and relent concerning this disaster planned for your people.

ngiemboon: Kímte Ábalaham, mbɔɔ Ésàg ńgÿo Yakwɔ̂b pie ée megàŋafàʼ pú. Kwàʼ gù la gɔɔn mbwó pɔ́b tà ńkʉa ngie: N ge láʼ gÿo ngẅɛ̀ gi pú ńgyɔ́ɔn, tà ńgwɔ́ páʼ mecÿɔ́ʼsaŋ mie ée lefaŋ, n ge láʼ ná ngwòŋ gẅie n da kaʼ, á mbwó ngẅɛ̀ gi, e láʼa ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ́b fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm.
en: Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Israel #— #you swore to them by yourself   and declared, ‘I will make your offspring as numerous as the stars of the sky and will give your offspring all this land that I have promised, and they will inherit it forever.’ ”  # 32:13 Gn 12:7; 13:15; 15:7,18; 26:4; 35:11–12

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a nyé yɛ̌ nò tepòŋ gie á la gwaa gwɔ́ mbà à kaʼá légÿo na pʉ̀a pé.
en: So the Lord relented   concerning the disaster he had said he would bring on his people.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê gíŋe fó ndùm lekwɛ́ sẅɛ́ʼ, ńgẅiin melàŋa kʉ̀a mémbʉ́a á mbwó yé; ammó laa ye ŋweʼe na melàŋa ŋwɛ́, á na menzèm mémbʉ́a, á laa ye ŋweʼe na mejʉʼ mejʉʼ.
en: Then Moses turned and went down the mountain with the two tablets of the testimony in his hands. They were inscribed on both sides #— #inscribed front and back.

ngiemboon: Melàŋa é laa kwaʼ mie Ssé la nyɛte; ammó gie á laa ye ŋweʼe mǒ, á gwɔ́ kwàʼ gie Ssé zɔ la ŋweʼe na melàŋa ŋwɛ́.
en: The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was God’s writing, engraved on the tablets.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ gie Yǒonshûa la júʼ páʼ aláʼ la ne ńnáa gwá la, á gɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: ngyè ncù ne ńcʉ́me jʉʼʉ mentàb!
en: When Joshua heard the sound of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, “There is a sound of war in the camp.”

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: E te ngyè pajÿó ncù wɔ́, ńké te ngyè pagwe ncù wɔ́, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ mengyè mie n ne ńjúʼu.
en: But Moses replied,

ngiemboon: À la tsóte nnɛ́ tà ńne ńkúu jʉʼʉ mentàb, ńgyá tútú, mbɔɔ páʼ aláʼ ne ńzíŋe. Á gwɔ́ púʼu Mǒonsê gyáŋa lóŋ; ḿmaʼ melàŋa má ssé, á tsìŋe lekwɛ́, é pagte.
en: As he approached the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, Moses became enraged and threw the tablets out of his hands, smashing them at the base of the mountain.

ngiemboon: Á kaa tútú gẅie pɔ́ la pwóon la, ńtuɔ mmɔ̌g; ńgwɔʼ tà á cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mvɔbɔ́, á néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńgÿo pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ nú.
en: He took the calf they had made, burned it up, and ground it to powder. He scattered the powder over the surface of the water and forced the Israelites to drink the water.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê zɛ́te Áloŋ ngie: Yɔɔn láʼ gÿǒ lêkɔ́ na gù tá ɔ̀ gÿo pɔ́ fʉa yɔɔn ntí nò?
en: Then Moses asked Aaron, “What did these people do to you that you have led them into such a grave sin? ”

ngiemboon: Áloŋ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: Tsétsɔʼ, te gíŋe ńgyáŋa lóŋ me ndè! Kwàʼ gù ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pɔɔn: Anò tepòŋ la jÿó wɔ́b.
en: “Don’t be enraged, my lord,” Aaron replied. “You yourself know that the people are intent on evil.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Nyɛte tsɔ́ messé né peg, é mie é ge gwɔ́ mvfò peg, é tseen wég! Mélàʼmie Mǒonsê wɛ̂, á mbàŋa gẅie à la gÿo peg fó Egíbtò ńkẅɛ la, peg te ne ńzsé mmó gie á kéen ńgÿo yé wɔ́!
en: They said to me, ‘Make gods for us who will go before us because this Moses, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt #— #we don’t know what has happened to him! ’

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: epʉ̀a pie é gẅiin shúm sie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, pɔ́ sẅɛ; pɔ́ sẅɛ ńná né mèŋ; n dɔ́ɔn tà é sí, n dɔg nyɛte wɔɔn tútú.
en: So I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, take it off,’ and they gave it to me. When I threw it into the fire, out came this calf! ”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la gwɔ́ tà ńgyá ngie aláʼ cʉ́ʼʉ ńgÿo pɔ́ páʼ á kwǒŋ, mélàʼmie Áloŋ la nyé wɔ́b tà pɔ́ té nyé ńkúʼte mbùm yɔb wɔ́: á gwɔ́ púʼu, ńdɔg ńná shÿó mbwó megàŋmbù pɔ́b lényime wɔ́b.
en: Moses saw that the people were out of control, for Aaron had let them get out of control, making them a laughingstock to their enemies.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê tó ńtyé ncwò jʉʼʉ mentàb ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á tó né lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ! Á gɔɔn púʼu, epʉ̀a Lěvî ntsèm leen ńtó ńtyé, ńtÿɔ́ʼɔ yé ńnéŋe soŋ.
en: And Moses stood at the camp’s entrance and said, “Whoever is for the Lord, come to me.” And all the Levites gathered around him.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ gɔ̌ɔn, ayɔɔn: Awɔ̌ɔwɔ́ɔ na pi wɔ́ɔ, à shÿɔ́g nně ncù ye, á lejÿɔgɔ́ kwɔb yé; pi cʉa ńgwá ńtɔ́gte jʉʼʉ mentàb, ńgiŋe mencwò ndá, nyìŋ zẅé fɛ̌ we, ńzẅé shǔ we, ńzẅé ngàŋ nkwɔʼɔ́ ndá we!
en: He told them, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says, ‘Every man fasten his sword to his side; go back and forth through the camp from entrance to entrance, and each of you kill his brother, his friend, and his neighbor.’ ”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Lěvî la gÿo mmó gie Mǒonsê la gɔɔn: Á laa lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ kwéte tà ńgwɔ́ mmó ntsáʼ tá.
en: The Levites did as Moses commanded, and about three thousand men fell dead that day among the people.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a Lěvî ngie: Mé cʉmé fàʼa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mbwó pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn. Mélàʼmie pi kaa mʉ́ʼte lézẅé penkʉ́ pí, mbɔɔ mefɛ̌ pí wɔ́. Á poŋ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a néŋ mbʉ́lè ye na pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: Afterward Moses said, “Today you have been dedicated   to the Lord, since each man went against his son and his brother. Therefore you have brought a blessing on yourselves today.”  # 32:29 Nm 25:11–13; Zch 13:3

ngiemboon: Njÿó la lʉ́a, Mǒonsê gɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie: Pi ka gÿo kwàʼ máa nò tepòŋ. Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, n ge pʉʉ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a: ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́, n kúu wó, ésẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á lege menò tepòŋ mí.
en: The following day Moses said to the people, “You have committed a grave sin. Now I will go up to the Lord; perhaps I will be able to atone for your sin.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la piŋ nzèm tà ńkúu mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsétsɔʼ, aláʼ yɔɔn ka gÿo máamáa nò tepòŋ. Pɔ́ ka lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, ńnyɛte tsɔ́ messé mɔ́b.
en: So Moses returned to the Lord and said, “Oh, these people have committed a grave sin; they have made a god of gold for themselves.

ngiemboon: Tsétsɔʼ lege mefʉa mɔ́b! Ńké te púʼu wɔ́, ɔ̀ véle lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne legwɔ́ wó gie ɔ̀ la ŋweʼe.
en: Now if you would only forgive their sin. But if not, please erase me from the book you have written.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie n ge véle yé tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne yɔ́ɔn, aa nyìŋ gẅie à ka fʉa nò mbwó mèŋ.
en: The Lord replied to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against me I will erase from my book.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, lo; gÿo aláʼ gʉa tà ńkúu jʉʼ gie n da gɔɔn mbwó gù. Angàŋntúm wɔɔn ge ne giŋe mvfò gù; táʼ alyɛ̌ʼ gie n ge gÿo zyeen, n gÿo pɔ́ píte ncwò wɔ́b na mefʉa mɔ́b.
en: Now go, lead the people to the place I told you about; see, my angel will go before you. But on the day I settle accounts, I will hold them accountable for their sin.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó láʼa Ésàlayɛ, mélàʼmie pɔ́ la gɔɔn né Áloŋ ngie à pwóon tútú gẅie à sẅé múɔ fòŋ.
en: And the Lord inflicted a plague on the people for what they did with the calf Aaron had made.
